project_name: UPM-2814943 - 505 Bayview Dr - Barrie (CLDC) - CMCC Additional Monitoring
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Sebastian Vandervort (2):offer submitted by Sebastian Vandervort

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem:
The latest Windows Update patch (KB5027215) is causing instability on Windows 10 machines. Every 4-5 hours the operators in the Canadian Monitoring Center (who monitor US and Canadian DCs during off-hours and weekends) have to do a procedure to rollback this update on each machine, but Intune management system detects this and starts the process of reinitiating the patch. A temporary solution has been found and is now active. The update however is sitting in the background and is waiting to be installed. We believe the time to install automatically is 7 days which will be on Friday July 7th. Once this happens we will have to roll back the update again.

Kyndryl service desk was notified Friday June 30th and ticket #INC7182796 opened up. They advised a resolution is expected but no timeline was given.
scope_of_work.scope: CMCC stations will be monitored and update rolled back once latest patch installs automatically or if for any reason there is a power outage that affects any or all stations. Each site affected will be contacted and expected to monitor remotely until the connection to the affected sites have been restored. The on call operator for CMCC will also be contacted to report to CLDC and assist with restoring those work stations as well as monitoring and contacting other sites for any other issues
scope_of_work.justification: Adequate monitoring of CMCC stations (Kyndryl Sites)
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Inadequate monitoring of CMCC stations (Kyndryl Sites) is a possibility with alarms being missed dealing with multiple issues in CMCC

project_name: UPM-2816276 - 3600 Steeles Ave East Markham - Replacement of current outdated IPKVM switch with new Switch
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Sebastian Vandervort (2):offer submitted by Sebastian Vandervort

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: Replacement of the Startech IPKVM's switch as it is roughly 6 years old, and was not the newest technology when it was purchased. Since then these devices have been discontinued by the manufacturer and have not had a firmware update in several years
scope_of_work.scope: Removed current switch, replace with new, test and confirm remote view and accessibility
scope_of_work.justification:
Currently, operators staff are having significant lag issues when moving the mouse and accuracy issues on getting the remote pointer over the correct screen target to click on. The new devices have newer hardware and software that should make using them much faster(we currently have lag on cursor movement) as well as supporting higher resolutions than the current devices. 1080p vs 4k.
These devices are also certified Java-free, giving us and the client peace of mind that they are not vulnerable to the many recent exploits that have come out.

scope_of_work.problem: 3600 Steeles Landlord to conduct Tri-Annual Substation Maintenance and Service. CBRE DC Operations team to Transfer DC Site Loads (Mechanical and IT) to Emergency Power for the duration of service and restore back to Utility Power feeds upon completion of TriAnnnual service.
scope_of_work.scope:
CBRE Operations team on site 1 hour prior to start of activity to implement approved switching procedures and transfer both IT and Mechanical Loads to Emergency generators feed. Substation service will commence upon DC team confrmation of all successful load 
transfers. Monitoring will continue for the duration of the activity. Landlord will inform when service is completed, CBRE operations team to closely monitor utility feeds than proceed to initiate re-transfer of both IT and mechanical loads to hydro power. Our PLC system 
incorporates a 30 minute re-transfer delay to ensure all hydro feeds are available with free of anomalies
scope_of_work.justification: Substation provides Hydro power to both 3600 and 3500 Steeles. Both IT and Mechanical loads are required to be safely transferred to emergency feeds through a controlled measure prior to a full substation isolation. or black-out
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: This activity is being driven by the landlord

scope_of_work.problem: Stulz CRAC unit B6-3 is located close to the CPPIB area (colocation). It's not providing/maintaining the desired cooling in that area.
scope_of_work.scope:
Stulz CRAC unit B6-3 is not providing the desired temperature on the 2nd raised floor. Vendor Ainsworth checked the unit and found a few defects in this unit.The vendor will figure out the leak and repair it as well. Their SOW is as follows:
-Recover refrigerant.
-Pressurize system with Nitrogen.
-Locate and repair all leaks.
-Confirm no further leaks.
-Evacuate and charge with R407C refrigerant to proper running conditions, superheat and subcooling.
-Monitor and verify all operation.
scope_of_work.justification: Stulz CRAC unit B6-3 is located close to the CPPIB area (colocation). It's not providing/maintaining the desired cooling in that area.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: If the floor temperature is not maintained. The IT servers close to the CRAC units can be shut down due to heating.

scope_of_work.problem:
3500 Steeles IBM to conduct Tri-Annual Substation Maintenance and Service. CBRE DC Operations team to Transfer DC Site Loads (Mechanical and IT) to Emergency Power for the duration of service and restore back to Utility Power feeds, upon completion of work.

scope_of_work.scope:
Reason for the Uplif: The diesel invoice is higher than the original estimated amount.

scope_of_work.scope:
zFrame in G4N04-15 to be swapped with newer model.
Qty 4 Disconnect/Reconnect.
De-energize the RPP circuit breaker and unplug the power bar plug from the electrical whip receptacle. Data Center team will swap the zFrame.
Electrician to reconnect the plug to the receptacle and energize the RPP circuit breaker.
RPP-G4-2A1 PNL-2 CCT#8/10/12, RPP-G4-2A1 PNL-2 CCT#14/16/18, RPP-G4-2B1 PNL-2 CCT#8/10/12, RPP-G4-2B1 PNL-2 CCT#14/16/18

Follow CBRE procedure to perform the work.
Cabinet and Power Receptacles must be labelled.
Update the panel schedule.
Update any require log-book for new install.
This work is to be done during after hours. Possibility of changing to reglar hours.
In case any issue with new frame, we need to roll back the change and old frame to be connected back to power and new frame to be disconnected.
scope_of_work.justification: As per client request

project_name: UPM-2822510 - 100 Gough Road, Markham - Generator 2 Open Breaker Status Alarm Operations call-in/fix
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Sebastian Vandervort (2):offer submitted by Sebastian Vandervort

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: Received Gen 2 Open Breaker Status Alarm
scope_of_work.scope:
Toromont Report:

Arrive on site and speak with customer. Customer complaint of several issues:

HMI screen locked up and couldnt be restarted
G2 is in shutdown, no indication due to HMI not working
G2 was showing breaker open status and will not start when requested.



Perform initial inspection. Find that HMI computer is running and display is active. Close out factory talk launcher and ensure that runtime file is located on machine. Re-launch factorytalk and load application. When application is loaded, run program and ensure that program is communicating, all displays are functional. Verify that shutdown was caused by synchronizing controller shutdown command. Verify that HMI shows status of 52-G2 as open. Go to generator to verify that breaker is closed. Inspect wiring in EMCP panel and find no issues. Remove wiring from CB-AUX contacts and open and close breaker to ensure signal is present. Re-install interconnect wiring and move to switchgear cell for G2. Locate interconnect terminal at 3T3-10. Locate I/O input as Card 5, slot 4, Input 7. When terminal driver pushes against terminal, status light on I/O card activates, and when released, input deactivates. Remove wire from generator side of terminal and inspect. No issues found and re-install and tighten. Input still not active. Remove wire on PLC side of terminal. Inspect wire and terminal. Suspect that ferrule on wire was being pinched above the tube, on the plastic, and was making incidental contact with the terminal. Re-installed wire and torqued connections. Verify that status of breaker was now active, and moving wire or terminal doesnt affect the signal as previous. This is the root cause of failure for why the generator didnt start when requested. PLC logic will prevent start of generator in automatic if 52-G2 is shown as open, and due to bad connection, PLC logic was given a false status even though breaker was physically closed. Connected to the ComAp controller to gather history log and ensure no further issues other than generator didnt start and shutdown caused by it not seeing generator voltage. Once this was confirmed, placed ECS in off and reset shutdown for G2. Placed ECS back in automatic. Customer now activated transfer at ATS#10. All three generators started. G3 closed breaker first, then G2, then after some delay, approximately 3 minutes, G1 closed the breaker. Some concern with length of time to synchronize breaker, but with the knowledge that ComAP controllers are limited in PID functionality, some trade off must be made for performance vs. stability vs. Load sharing acceptance on transients. Returned system to normal and generators opened breakers and shutdown accordingly. Informed customer of all findings and no further issues present at this time. All units back in operational state.
scope_of_work.justification: on-call support exceeding 8 hrs
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: contractual obligation

project_name: UPM-2823166 - 505 Bayview Dr - Barrie (CLDC) - BAS Server Repair
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Sebastian Vandervort (2):work order closed by Sebastian Vandervort (3):work planning by Sebastian Vandervort (4):offer approved by Sebastian Vandervort (5):offer submitted by Sebastian Vandervort

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: BAS server has crashed and requires repairs. No alarms are being sent out to the pager and no pop ups are coming up on the screen. JCI has been on site and have configured the network engines to send alarms to the pager but are unable to have pop ups on the screen. A complete server repair/rebuild is required.
scope_of_work.scope:
JCI in conjunction with CBRE support will perform the below activities.

Day -1

Reload of metasys on the BAS servers as the current version is not capturing all alarms.

-One server will be configured at a time and while that is being done the other will be our eyes to monitor the system. CBRE personnel on site to monitor and act accordingly should any unforeseen issues occur.
-Once completed some test alarms will be sent out to verify system operation as well as confirmation of the redundant backup scheme.
-Perform BAS migration to move the current Metasys application to a temporary server. During switch CBRE operators will monitor critical cooling equipment to ensure raised floor is adequately cooled as expected. (Metasys Reload Failed requiring additional visits)


Day -2

Metasys Server Migration.

CBRE and JCI will:
-Perform full windows backup of the Metasys server to external hard drive - no impact to application, equipment, or trending. ~1-2 hours depending on backup speed.
-Power down the Metasys VM, disconnect from Hyper-V cluster, COPY VM to new temporary server. ~45 minutes for file copy and startup of VM on new server.
-During migration, trending and control of NAEs will be unavailable. All NAE automation will run on current programming, alarms and alerts will still function as alerting is configured on NAEs at the moment.
-After power up of VM on new server, ensure data points are updating. Perform non impactful adjustment of a setpoint to ensure that control aspect of Metasys is functioning.
-Disconnect old server cluster from JCI network switch, unrack hardware, and move to the proper server rack in CMCC.
-Re-partition baremetal servers to isolate OS and data volumes, reconfigure vsan and cluster configuration.
-Connect baremetal chassis to Kyndryl 10. network, configure IMM, build net new Metasys VM. (Need to reserve IPs with Kyndryl).
-Confirm failover cluster operation. Troubleshoot if necessary.

Day -3

Metasys Server Installation and Swap Out

-JCI will be on site to load metasys on to the rebuilt servers which is to be configured and tested before migrating from the old to the rebuilt servers.

-After loading metasys to servers all NAE/NCE's will be verified connected and alarming capabilities tested along with paging.

-During cut over there will be a brief moment where metasys launcher will be unavailable (under 5 minutes), during which time all NAE/NCE will still have the
capability of alarming and alerting the operator via text messages of any critical alarm that may occur during that window. CBRE operators will perform visual
inspections on all critical equipment to confirm normal operation.

-All systems will be verified for operation once completed.
scope_of_work.justification: Bas Servers are required to have eyes on the critical equipment to validate their performance and interaction with the network engines located across the site.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Alarming capabilities minimized as well as reliability with no pop up of alarms on metasys application.

project_name: UPM-2824202 - 505 Bayview Dr. - Barrie (CLDC) - DG-1 Paralleling Breaker Failure Repair
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Maureen Gerlach (2):offer submitted by Maureen Gerlach

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem:
On Nov 09, 2023 at 00:13 a loss of 44KV utility A feed occurred resulting in the closure of the tie breaker to feed A loads from the B utility feed. The site team was on high alert as ice rain was expected. The utility provider was contacted to verify they were experiencing issues in the area. utility provider confirmed a tree fell on utility wires close to the site and they were working on restoring promptly. The relevant ERP and FSP were initiated with site checks during and follow up calls to the utility provider. Power was present at the meter at 02:09 and the utility provider confirmed it was safe to restore to normal line up as the power was stable. The site waited for another 15 minutes and reconfirmed with the utility provider as well as performed system checks to verify stability before restoring. The relevant FSP was used to restore the site to normal. During restoration 1 of 3 generators did not parallel to the bus (2 are required to perform any transfers). Once the site was restored another test of the failed generator was performed which also failed.

A service call was initiated and the next day OEM Technician was on site and provided a temporary resolution. A new auxiliary switch is required and will be ordered and replaced once received. A test was completed on the Generator and was successful. Another test was performed to test all 3 units and verify when called upon that all 3 will start and parallel to the emergency bus. That test was also successful. Once the part is in and installed both tests will be performed again to verify normal operation.
scope_of_work.scope: OEM vendor to supply and install Aux switch. Dg-1 will be tested to verify normal functionality after repairs are complete. A system test with all 3 generators will also be executed.
scope_of_work.justification: Reliability of DG-1 paralleling breaker to assume building load in the event of an emergency.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Decreased reliability of Dg-1 Paralleling Breaker
